title: What are the most fascinating future retail payment scenarios? - Quora

response.answer_text: I work for a cloud-based point of sale company. It is incredible watching new payment technologies unfold. Like near field communication (NFC) and check-in platforms like "PayPal Now" and "pay with Square." The most fascinating (and likely) future for retail payments is going to be a user check-in system. Instead of carrying a wallet and handing over credit cards, we'll just carry smartphones (which will only get smarter) notify of our intent to purchase with a payment app.  You can do this already. Watch and learn (and laugh):     I think this scenario is most likely as it requires no additional hardware purchases for retailers. It's entirely web-based. Yes, it requires the consumer to upgrade their "personal hardware" - but that is happening anyway.  In the future we might not even have to talk to anyone, if we don't want to. We'll just walk into a shop. Check into our preferred payment app. Pick up the item we'd like to purchase. Scan it with our smartphone and walk out. Transaction completed. A salesperson will be able to monitor the purchase through a point of sale terminal, as protection against theft.  I'd love to hear other prognostications, though. :)

The fast food giant is known for its quick drive-thru service, but now it’s taking things a step further with a new to-go location that only serves food with no seating. Think of it as McDonald’s of the future that has the potential to revolutionize fast food and restaurants. McDonald’s recently opened a to-go location in London.Customers order via touchscreen kiosks and quickly pick up their food to go—there’s no seating in the restaurant.The concept leverages technology to make ordering easier and faster.McDonald’s is providing an option for busy customers on the go to get their food even faster than before.The concept is already expanding to retail stores and could soon be done by other restaurants.”Source: A Sign Of The Future Restaurant: The New McDonald’s To-Go Location
